summary:
Nitrogen (symbol N) is a non-metallic element with the atomic number 7. It's the seventh most common element in the Milky Way and the Solar System. At room temperature, nitrogen atoms form a colorless, odorless gas (N2) which makes up 78% of Earth's atmosphere. Discovered in 1772, it's used in food packaging and cryogenic applications today.

Nitrogen is essential for life, found in proteins, DNA, and other organic compounds. The human body is about 3% nitrogen. It plays a crucial role in fertilizers and pharmaceuticals, including antibiotics.
title: Nitrogen
